SEARCH
Package nn.losses

Class Loss

java.lang.Object
nn.losses.Loss
Direct Known Subclasses:
CrossEntropyLoss
public abstract class Loss extends Object
Abstract base class for loss functions in neural networks. This class provides the structure and necessary methods that all specific loss function implementations must adhere to. Loss functions evaluate how well the model performs by comparing the predicted output to the actual target.

    • Loss

      public Loss()

  • Method Details

    • get_loss

      public Value get_loss()
      Returns the current loss value calculated by the loss function.
      Returns:
      The current loss value as a Value. It can be null if the loss has not yet been calculated or has been reset.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the loss value to null. This method is useful for clearing the loss information before a new calculation or after gradients have been propagated.

    • calculate_loss

      public abstract Value calculate_loss(MultiDimObject input, MultiDimObject target)
      Calculates the loss between the predicted output and the target.
      Parameters:
      input - The predicted output from the model as a MultiDimObject.
      target - The actual target output as a MultiDimObject.
      Returns:
      The calculated loss as a Value.

    • add

      public abstract void add(double value)
      Adds a scalar value to the current loss value.
      Parameters:
      value - The scalar value to be added to the loss.

    • add

      public abstract void add(Value value)
      Adds a Value to the current loss value.
      Parameters:
      value - The Value to be added to the loss.

    • divide

      public abstract void divide(double value)
      Divides the current loss value by a scalar value.
      Parameters:
      value - The scalar value by which to divide the loss.

    • divide

      public abstract void divide(Value value)
      Divides the current loss value by a Value.
      Parameters:
      value - The Value by which to divide the loss.

    • backward

      public abstract void backward()
      Performs backpropagation to calculate the gradient of the loss function with respect to the model's parameters. This method is crucial for the training process, allowing the optimizer to adjust the parameters appropriately.
